intro: Taraxacum balticum, commonly known as the Baltic dandelion, is a perennial flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. It produces a hollow, wind-dispersed seed head, which is a defining feature of the dandelion genus. Taraxacum balticum thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
